s.text: But the piece waits until the tenth paragraph to note that this was reported yesterday in the Washington Times . (This story is also inside today's Post .)
The USAT headline--"Biotech Firm to Aid Tobacco Probe"--makes the whole thing sound like good citizenship rather than a plea bargain.

The WP seems to reveal that this juror ended up with at least a touch of militia-style animus against the feds when it quotes her remark: "I think the government's attitude.is part of where all this comes from in the first place.
